Package InterfaceUser

Interface InitGame

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Game

    public interface InitGame
    Lists the functions needed for interactions between the application and the user to initialize the game. Implemented in the class Game.
    Author:
    Benjamin Héroult
    See Also:
    Game

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void beginGame​()
      Informs the user of the beginning of the game.
      int choosePlayers​(java.util.Scanner scan)
      Asks the number of players desired.
      void chooseRule​(java.util.Scanner scan)
      Asks the rule that the game musts use, and call the method to define it.
      int difficulty​(java.util.Scanner scan)
      Asks the difficulty level wanted by the user.
      void displayRanking​()
      Displays the final ranking, at the end of the game.
      int initCards​(java.util.Scanner scan)
      Asks the number of decks desired.
      java.lang.String initPlayer​(java.util.Scanner scan)
      Asks to the user his username
      void seePlayers​()
      Uses the attribute players_name to displays all players in the game.

    • Method Detail

      • initPlayer

        java.lang.String initPlayer​(java.util.Scanner scan)
        Asks to the user his username
        Parameters:
        scan - avoids to restart a new scan
        Returns:
        the name entered by the user to define his username

      • choosePlayers

        int choosePlayers​(java.util.Scanner scan)
        Asks the number of players desired. Verifies if the entry is a number and in the right interval (1 to 6) .
        Parameters:
        scan - avoids to restart a new scan
        Returns:
        the number of players chosen

      • initCards

        int initCards​(java.util.Scanner scan)
        Asks the number of decks desired. Verifies if the entry is a number and in the right interval (1 or 2).
        Parameters:
        scan - avoids to restart a new scan
        Returns:
        the number of decks chosen

      • chooseRule

        void chooseRule​(java.util.Scanner scan)
        Asks the rule that the game musts use, and call the method to define it. Verifies if the entry is a number and in the right interval (1 or 2).
        Parameters:
        scan - avoids to restart a new scan

      • displayRanking

        void displayRanking​()
        Displays the final ranking, at the end of the game.

      • beginGame

        void beginGame​()
        Informs the user of the beginning of the game.

      • seePlayers

        void seePlayers​()
        Uses the attribute players_name to displays all players in the game.

      • difficulty

        int difficulty​(java.util.Scanner scan)
        Asks the difficulty level wanted by the user.
        Parameters:
        scan - avoids to restart a new scan
        Returns:
        the number representing the difficulty level
